intro: Campylocentrum pubirhachis, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed campylocentrum, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clustered, small, white or pale blue flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
